info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 08 at 3:33PM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Hampshire and central Franklin Counties through 430 PM EDT... At 331 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Whately, or 10 miles south of Greenfield, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph & Heavy rain in excess of 1 inch SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Strong winds could cause minor damage such as downed branches. Do not drive through flooded roads or underpasses. Avoid low lying areas near small streams. Locations impacted include... Amherst, Greenfield, Deerfield, Montague, Hadley, Sunderland, Hatfield, Northfield, Williamsburg, Buckland, Conway, Shelburne, Leverett, Erving, Shutesbury, Ashfield, Gill, Whately, Pelham and Goshen. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Get indoors when you hear thunder. Do not resume outdoor activities until at least 30 minutes after the storm has passed. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. For your safety, go indoors or to your vehicle.
